subject: Medicine
title: The Polio Vaccine
description: Learn The Polio Vaccine in one minute.

hook.text: In the 1950s, parents kept children home from pools and playgrounds in terror of an invisible crippler.

buildup.text: Polio paralyzed thousands of children each year. Iron lungs filled hospital wards across America.

discovery.text: Jonas Salk developed an injected vaccine using killed virus. Field trials involved 1.8 million children.

twist.text: When asked who owned the patent, Salk replied: 'The people. Could you patent the sun?'

climax.text: Polio cases dropped 99%. The vaccine proved that science could conquer humanity's worst fears.

punchline.text: He gave the cure away. The world was his patient.

quiz.question: What was notable about Jonas Salk's polio vaccine patent?
options: He refused to patent it, keeping it free for everyone
He sold exclusive rights to one company
The government forced him to share the patent
